programme.title: Bloodfist
programme.desc: A Los Angeles kickboxer (Don "The Dragon" Wilson) trains with a master (Joe Marie Avellana) in Manila to avenge his brother in a tournament.

programme.title: Betty: They Say I'm Different
programme.desc: Betty Davis arrives on the '70s scene to break boundaries for women with her daring personality and outrageous funk music. She then, despite being banned and boycotted, goes on to become the first black woman to perform, write and manage herself.

programme.title: Sparkle
programme.desc: The demands of success take their toll on three Harlem sisters who reach the heights of musical stardom in the 1950s.

programme.title: Graffiti Bridge
programme.desc: The Kid (Prince) and his rock-club rival (Morris Day) disagree about music in a sequel to the 1984 film "Purple Rain."

programme.title: The Dragon, the Hero
programme.desc: A kung-fu fighter goes back to Hong Kong to help a friend fight gangsters.

programme.title: The Clones of Bruce Lee
programme.desc: A brilliant professor gathers cells from the late Bruce Lee and constructs three perfect clones. Trained to be masters, the clones battle to stop criminals and smugglers.

programme.title: Enter the Game of Death
programme.desc: In the 1920s, three Chinese gang members try to retrieve a military document concerning a Japanese invasion.

programme.title: Rage of the Dragon
programme.desc: Dragon battles the diabolical Tim Loon Kai, the master of the Snake Fist style of martial arts.

programme.title: Legacy of Rage
programme.desc: Sentenced to prison for a crime he did not commit, a man sets out for revenge after his release from jail.

programme.title: Rock and Roll Revue
programme.desc: Vintage clips of great jazz artists.

programme.title: Betty: They Say I'm Different
programme.desc: Betty Davis arrives on the '70s scene to break boundaries for women with her daring personality and outrageous funk music. She then, despite being banned and boycotted, goes on to become the first black woman to perform, write and manage herself.

programme.title: Jazz Session at the Blue Note With Chaka Khan
programme.sub-title: Jazz Session at the Blue Note With Chaka Khan
programme.desc: Recorded in 1993 at the Blue Note Jazz Club in New York City, this performance by Chaka Khan features a number of songs closely associated with jazz.

programme.title: Crime Story
programme.desc: A former mob boss embarks on a deadly rampage of revenge after he becomes the target of a home robbery. However, when his family gets caught in the crossfire, he must finally face the consequences of his dark past.

programme.title: To All My Friends on Shore
programme.desc: A working-class man (Bill Cosby) works hard for his family, then learns his son has sickle cell anemia.

programme.title: Disorderlies
programme.desc: A greedy heir (Anthony Geary) hires three inept, rap-singing orderlies (The Fat Boys) to care for his rich uncle (Ralph Bellamy).

programme.title: Who's the Man?
programme.desc: Two Harlem barbers (Ed Lover, Andre Romelle Young) score well on a multiple-choice police exam and use their badges to expose a ruthless developer.
